# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25215?src=pr&el=h1) Report

> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25215/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&token=eZ4WkYLtcO&height=150&src=pr)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25215?src=pr&el=tree)

```diff
@@            Coverage Diff             @@
##           master   #25215      +/-   ##
==========================================
+ Coverage   92.34%   92.35%   +<.01%     
==========================================
  Files         166      166              
  Lines       52314    52314              
==========================================
+ Hits        48311    48312       +1     
+ Misses       4003     4002       -1
```

|---|---|---|

| #single | `42.84% <ø> (-0.01%)` | :arrow_down: |

|---|---|---|
| [pandas/util/testing.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25215/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL3V0aWwvdGVzdGluZy5weQ==) | `88.05% <0%> (+0.09%)` | :arrow_up: |

|---|---|---|

| [pandas/core/dtypes/dtypes.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25215/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL2NvcmUvZHR5cGVzL2R0eXBlcy5weQ==) | `95.6% <0%> (+0.01%)` | :arrow_up: |

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25215?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [6359bbc...515447d](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25215?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
it shows you are deleting a file, is that intentional? maybe need to update the .gitignore.

@jreback I think this is some odd bug in github reporting.  It shows on the files changed:
```
BIN -4 Bytes (100%) doc/cheatsheet/Pandas_Cheat_Sheet.pptx
```
But if you click on that file, it shows it is 103KB big, which is correct.  So I don't see the deletion that you refer to.

Looking at the file that is in master and the file in my pull request, the new file is 4 bytes smaller (makes sense - I only deleted a single quote), comparing to master.  The "-100%" is wrong.
Hmm that's weird. I suppose its the same issue we are seeing in #25032 then
@WillAyd Possibly so, but if there are two pending pull requests on the cheat sheet, they will not merge correctly. because the files are binary
For sure; whichever gets merged first will have to be accounted for in second PR
@Dr-Irv can you rebase here (sorry the other PR was first) :>

@jreback I've done that.  Note that I think these fixes should get published as soon as possible to the pandas doc web site rather than wait for a new release, since the changes here and in #25032 are just fixing typos.

I can upload these manually I think. Just ping me again once this is merged.

Hmm it looks like our current one is pretty out of data.

Does this get included anywhere in the rst documentation? Or is it just the
link from getting_started/tutorials.rst ->
pandas.pydata.org/Pandas_Cheat_Sheet.pdf?

It seems like these are getting cached pretty aggressively. I removed the
files completely, but we were still serving them.

When I scp the files from the server locally, I have the corrected version.

Let's check again tomorrow.

On Mon, Feb 11, 2019 at 8:26 PM Irv Lustig <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @TomAugspurger <https://github.com/TomAugspurger> can you check that? If
> I go to http://pandas.pydata.org/Pandas_Cheat_Sheet.pdf, I'm seeing the
> old version. You can tell by looking in two places:
>
>    1. On the left side, right above "Create DataFrame with a MultiIndex",
>    there should be two right parens.
>    2. The last regex on the right side should have one single quote, not
>    two.
